intro: Lenticula minor, commonly known as the lesser lenticular vine, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Lenticula minor is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
